metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6130 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Race condition in the sclp_ctl_ioctl_sccb function indrivers/s390/char/sclp_ctl.c in the Linux kernel before 4.6 allows localusers to obtain sensitive information from kernel memory by changing acertain length value, aka a "double fetch" vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6130` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-42.62
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-42.62
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-42.62
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-42.62').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
